result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrion J Wise

defendant.name: Wise, Terrion J
defendant.address: c/o Milwaukee House of Corrections, 8885 South 68th Street, Franklin, WI 53132

records.addlTxt: Detainer placed at: Milwaukee House of Corrections

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

3:37 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Terrion J Wise appeared by video, in custody at Milwaukee House of Corrections.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Terrion J Wise. 

The Court quashes the warrant.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Miller is appointed. 
Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived. 
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT BE PRODUCED FROM THE MILWAUKEE HOUSE OF CORRECTIONS FOR THE NEXT HEARING.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Terrion J Wise
